intro: Bupleurum verticale, commonly known as the upright celery or slender bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or dry habitats. The plant features slender, upright stems with small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Bupleurum verticale is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
